p: Because of the favorable half-life of the fluorine isotope 18F (109.8 min), it stands out as a unique atom which is used in positron emission tomography (PET). 18F became a powerful tool used for detection of various cancer types [ 9, 10, 11]. Ojima has introduced fluorine into taxoid anticancer agents and studied their tumor-targeted drug delivery systems [ 12].
